11.1.19  1:19 am   Hey Bill, what inspires you to, yknow, keep doing this? I do a lot of creative work myself and it's really, really easy to feel like i'm not improving or that it isn't worth it. im curious if you've dealt with that, i'm sure you have, and how you get around it. I know you've got a big following, and i'm sure that helps, but still.

10.31.19  10:52 pm   Hi Bill. Do you have an specific hour of the day for recording vocals?

      I'm currently living alone in my apartment and I don't want to bother my neighbour. I'd met him before and it seems like he's a good guy (he listens the band Air Supply once a day). How do you deal with noise pollution? Thanks
10.31.19  10:42 pm   do the letters r, m and p in the scarmble section mean received, made and posted dates?

10.31.19  10:28 pm   Whenever I think about numbers, I find myself getting lost. Like, once you get past 10 nonillion or so, the number you're talking about is so large that there is no meaningful comparison for it in the universe. The largest numbers ever used constructively are Graham's Number and tree(3), both so unbelievably large that the number of digits in the number of digits in the number of digits in them can't be imagined. Yet there are always numbers larger. In fact, considering all the natural numbers in a row, these numbers are functionally no different than 0 in terms of how close to the end you are. Do you ever find yourself getting lost in stuff like this?
10.31.19  9:50 pm   how do i summon music?

10.31.19  9:06 pm   on blender, assuming you are using cycles render,

      make sure in the render settings in the 'sampling' section the samples value isn't placed too high, because that value is different from the preview value. setting the value too low will add a lot of noise to the image, but setting it too high takes too long
